Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with green leaves to show it has enough water, demonstrating the healthy condition of the plant.
The student can accurately draw a plant with wilting or brown leaves to show it does not have enough water, indicating poor health due to lack of water.
The student can effectively illustrate a sun shining to show that plants need light to grow and thrive.
The student can represent the soil and roots in the drawing to demonstrate where plants might get water from the ground.
The student can depict both a sunlit plant and one kept in the dark to compare their growth and health, showing the plant in the sun is healthier.
The student can draw different types of plants to observe patterns of growth with and without water, showing a clear understanding of variations.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally miss small details like minor elements of the soil affecting water absorption (e.g., texture, depth).
The student may not consistently label all parts of the drawing, like every individual root or sun ray, due to oversight rather than misunderstanding.
